main event: On two evenings in April 1967, a family observed a bright, stationary object near their home in Camden, Ohio.
interesting points: The object resembled a brilliant, low-hanging, grayish-white light,The object remained in view for about 45 minutes before assuming a reddish glow and disappearing,The sightings were reported on April 3 and April 11,Other reports from Preble County, Ohio, and Indiana indicated similar sightings, The report suggests the object may have been Venus, known for its high brightness in the sky.
sighted object: bright, stationary object resembling a brilliant, low-hanging light
